title: double nearly triple ping increase in the past 3 weeks minnesota.
body:
So i ran a tracert and for some reason my isp is directing my traffic minnesota to new york before going to the chicago servers. Needless to say going a thousand miles in the wrong direction is less than ideal.

here is the tracert results from the connectivity troubleshooting support page. 
Tracing route to 192.64.170.1 over a maximum of 30 hops

  1    <1 ms    <1 ms    <1 ms  192.168.0.1 
  2    24 ms    25 ms    25 ms  stpl-dsl-gw13.stpl.qwest.net [207.109.2.13] 
  3    25 ms    22 ms    23 ms  stpl-agw1.inet.qwest.net [207.109.3.97] 
  4    52 ms    52 ms    51 ms  jfk-edge-25.inet.qwest.net [67.14.5.170] 
  5    51 ms    52 ms    52 ms  63.151.150.226 
  6    52 ms    52 ms    52 ms  104.160.132.44 
  7    67 ms    67 ms    68 ms  ae31-br01.chi01.riotdirect.net [104.160.159.14] 
  8    69 ms    69 ms    69 ms  104.160.131.101 
  9    68 ms    68 ms    68 ms  192.64.170.1 

Trace complete.

replies.body: any update on the routing issue with Centurylink? its been well over a month now, with no change.

We have actually heard reports of these types of issues in Minnesota and we believe this is a routing issue with one of the major ISP's in this area. We are currently working with them to make sure that they peer with us properly so we can get you the fastest route possible to our servers.

 Just to clarify, what ISP are you currently using?

Yep, this is currently one of the ISP's that are experiencing these issues :(  We are going to continue working with them and hopefully can get peering turned on with them in the future to get you a faster path.  Unfortunately, I don't have any kind of ETA when this might happen :(

It is something on our radar though!
a bunch of us had fine ping before the server maintenance now its bad why would that happen?

well if you live in minnesota and have centurylink as your isp the reason is centurylink changed the path our data takes to get to riot servers, now as for the reason they decided to make the change i have no idea.
So is it collectively know that this is on centurylinks end? swapping isp would fix this issue then?

> [{quoted}](name=212145,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=kEgQz7ro,comment-id=000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-06-03T01:16:51.591+0000)
>
> So is it collectively know that this is on centurylinks end? swapping isp would fix this issue then?

For minnesota yes, I play with my brother who has comcast and he gets about 28ms ping. I'm in the 70s. Sort of stopped playing until this gets sorted out though so that is accurate as of a couple weeks ago.

Here to confirm this. I'm in the exact same situation as OP, live in MN with centurylink and for about the last 3-4 weeks. I've been reading through boards waiting for someone to acknowledge this. Thanks!
